text: Does anyone know a good, short, entry-level introduction to why bayesian data analysis is cool suitable for undergrads?

elements.text: Does anyone know a good, short, entry-level introduction to why bayesian data analysis is cool suitable for undergrads?

text: Less about the practical data analysis aspect, but I found Grant's video quite a nice introduction to the underlying concept of Bayesian analysis: <https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HZGCoVF3YvM>

attachments.title: Bayes theorem

elements.text: Less about the practical data analysis aspect, but I found Grant's video quite a nice introduction to the underlying concept of Bayesian analysis:

text: Regression and other stories. Andrew Gelman & Co.

elements.text: Regression and other stories. Andrew Gelman & Co.

text: That’s like a 550-page book :slightly_smiling_face: I was just looking for something to pass interested students on my stats course
